triples.name: Multi-agent system
triples.relevance: The paper addresses consensus control problems for high-order nonlinear multiagent systems.

triples.name: Consensus dynamics
triples.relevance: The core problem being solved is achieving consensus among agents in a distributed network.

triples.name: Backstepping
triples.relevance: Backstepping is the fundamental control design technique used to develop the adaptive controller.

triples.name: Hermite interpolation
triples.relevance: Hermite interpolation is used to modify parameter estimators to ensure high-order derivatives exist.

triples.name: Adaptive control
triples.relevance: The paper develops an adaptive control scheme to estimate unknown leader parameters in real-time.

triples.name: Nonlinear control
triples.relevance: The paper addresses control of high-order nonlinear systems, requiring nonlinear control theory.

triples.name: Decentralised system
triples.relevance: The paper proposes a decentralized adaptive controller where each agent uses only local information.
